User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110202 Firefox/4.0b11pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110202 Firefox/4.0b11pre

In the Library, if you have a column sorted, you can not drag & drop bookmarks into a sub-folder.

Dropping bookmarks into the folder tree on the left panel still works, but you can not drop them into folders shown in the right panel.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the Library
2. Go to a folder that has both bookmarks and sub-folders
3. Make sure none of the visible columns are sorted ascending or descending
4. Drag & drop a bookmark into a folder (in the right panel).
5. Sort one of the columns
6. Drag & drop a bookmark into a folder (in the right panel).
Actual Results:  
At step 4, the bookmark is moved into the sub-folder
At step 6, the bookmark is not moved into the sub-folder

Expected Results:  
At step 6, the bookmark should be moved into the sub-folder

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110207 Firefox/4.0b12pre

After sorting one of the columns and trying to drag and drop one of the bookmarks into a folder the user experience is not the same as when the columns are not sorted in any way: the targeted folder does not become highlighted and for the bookmarked to be added in that folder the user has to wait 1 or 2 seconds while hovering with the bookmark over the desired folder.

To sum up, the bookmark is moved but the behavior is inconsistent.
